
true

   Succeeds always.



Arguments

Type
   Control

Description
   Succeeds.  For example, can be used as a default, to join the `then'
   path in ->/2 to the `if' path, or as a void event handler.




Resatisfiable
      No.

Fail Conditions
      None.



Examples
   
Success:
      (F \== "d.error" ->
           writeln(error, "Incorrect file "),
           writeln( error,F)
      ;
           true
      ),
      (L < 0 ->
           writeln(error, "Error in line number")
      ;
           true
      ).





See Also
   fail / 0, false / 0
